19namespace v8 {
20namespace internal {
21
22bool CpuFeatures::SupportsOptimizer() { return true; }
23
24void WritableRelocInfo::apply(intptr_t delta) {
25 // On arm64 only internal references and immediate branches need extra work.
26 if (RelocInfo::IsInternalReference(rmode_)) {
27 // Absolute code pointer inside code object moves with the code object.
28 intptr_t internal_ref = ReadUnalignedValue<intptr_t>(pc_);
29 internal_ref += delta; // Relocate entry.
30 WriteUnalignedValue<intptr_t>(pc_, internal_ref);
31 } else {
32 Instruction* instr = reinterpret_cast<Instruction*>(pc_);
33 if (instr->IsBranchAndLink() || instr->IsUnconditionalBranch()) {
34 Address old_target =
35 reinterpret_cast<Address>(instr->ImmPCOffsetTarget());
36 Address new_target = old_target - delta;
37 instr->SetBranchImmTarget<UncondBranchType>(
38 reinterpret_cast<Instruction*>(new_target));
39 }
40 }
41}
42
43inline bool CPURegister::IsSameSizeAndType(const CPURegister& other) const {
44 return (reg_size_ == other.reg_size_) && (reg_type_ == other.reg_type_);
45}
46
47inline bool CPURegister::IsZero() const {
48 DCHECK(is_valid());
49 return IsRegister() && (code() == kZeroRegCode);
50}
51
52inline bool CPURegister::IsSP() const {
53 DCHECK(is_valid());
54 return IsRegister() && (code() == kSPRegInternalCode);
55}
56
57inline void CPURegList::Combine(const CPURegList& other) {
58 DCHECK(other.type() == type_);
59 DCHECK(other.RegisterSizeInBits() == size_);
60 list_ |= other.list_;
61}
62
63inline void CPURegList::Remove(const CPURegList& other) {
64 if (other.type() == type_) {
65 list_ &= ~other.list_;
66 }
67}
68
69inline void CPURegList::Combine(const CPURegister& other) {
70 DCHECK(other.type() == type_);
71 DCHECK(other.SizeInBits() == size_);
72 Combine(other.code());
73}
74
75inline void CPURegList::Remove(const CPURegister& other1,
76 const CPURegister& other2,
77 const CPURegister& other3,
78 const CPURegister& other4) {
79 if (!other1.IsNone() && (other1.type() == type_)) Remove(other1.code());
80 if (!other2.IsNone() && (other2.type() == type_)) Remove(other2.code());
81 if (!other3.IsNone() && (other3.type() == type_)) Remove(other3.code());
82 if (!other4.IsNone() && (other4.type() == type_)) Remove(other4.code());
83}
84
85inline void CPURegList::Combine(int code) {
86 DCHECK(CPURegister::Create(code, size_, type_).is_valid());
87 list_ |= (1ULL << code);
88 DCHECK(is_valid());
89}
90
91inline void CPURegList::Remove(int code) {
92 DCHECK(CPURegister::Create(code, size_, type_).is_valid());
93 list_ &= ~(1ULL << code);
94}
95
96inline Register Register::XRegFromCode(unsigned code) {
97 if (code == kSPRegInternalCode) {
98 return sp;
99 } else {
100 DCHECK_LT(code, static_cast<unsigned>(kNumberOfRegisters));
101 return Register::Create(code, kXRegSizeInBits);
102 }
103}
104
105inline Register Register::WRegFromCode(unsigned code) {
106 if (code == kSPRegInternalCode) {
107 return wsp;
108 } else {
109 DCHECK_LT(code, static_cast<unsigned>(kNumberOfRegisters));
110 return Register::Create(code, kWRegSizeInBits);
111 }
112}
113
114inline VRegister VRegister::BRegFromCode(unsigned code) {
115 DCHECK_LT(code, static_cast<unsigned>(kNumberOfVRegisters));
116 return VRegister::Create(code, kBRegSizeInBits);
117}
118
119inline VRegister VRegister::HRegFromCode(unsigned code) {
120 DCHECK_LT(code, static_cast<unsigned>(kNumberOfVRegisters));
121 return VRegister::Create(code, kHRegSizeInBits);
122}
123
124inline VRegister VRegister::SRegFromCode(unsigned code) {
125 DCHECK_LT(code, static_cast<unsigned>(kNumberOfVRegisters));
126 return VRegister::Create(code, kSRegSizeInBits);
127}
128
129inline VRegister VRegister::DRegFromCode(unsigned code) {
130 DCHECK_LT(code, static_cast<unsigned>(kNumberOfVRegisters));
131 return VRegister::Create(code, kDRegSizeInBits);
132}
133
134inline VRegister VRegister::QRegFromCode(unsigned code) {
135 DCHECK_LT(code, static_cast<unsigned>(kNumberOfVRegisters));
136 return VRegister::Create(code, kQRegSizeInBits);
137}
138
139inline VRegister VRegister::VRegFromCode(unsigned code) {
140 DCHECK_LT(code, static_cast<unsigned>(kNumberOfVRegisters));
141 return VRegister::Create(code, kVRegSizeInBits);
142}
143
144inline Register CPURegister::W() const {
145 DCHECK(IsRegister());
146 return Register::WRegFromCode(code());
147}
148
149inline Register CPURegister::Reg() const {
150 DCHECK(IsRegister());
151 return Register::Create(code(), reg_size_);
152}
153
154inline VRegister CPURegister::VReg() const {
155 DCHECK(IsVRegister());
156 return VRegister::Create(code(), reg_size_);
157}

159inline Register CPURegister::X() const {
160 DCHECK(IsRegister());
161 return Register::XRegFromCode(code());
162}
163
164inline VRegister CPURegister::V() const {
165 DCHECK(IsVRegister());
166 return VRegister::VRegFromCode(code());
167}
168
169inline VRegister CPURegister::B() const {
170 DCHECK(IsVRegister());
171 return VRegister::BRegFromCode(code());
172}
173
174inline VRegister CPURegister::H() const {
175 DCHECK(IsVRegister());
176 return VRegister::HRegFromCode(code());
177}
178
179inline VRegister CPURegister::S() const {
180 DCHECK(IsVRegister());
181 return VRegister::SRegFromCode(code());
182}
183
184inline VRegister CPURegister::D() const {
185 DCHECK(IsVRegister());
186 return VRegister::DRegFromCode(code());
187}
188
189inline VRegister CPURegister::Q() const {
190 DCHECK(IsVRegister());
191 return VRegister::QRegFromCode(code());
192}

194// Immediate.
195// Default initializer is for int types
196template <typename T>
197struct ImmediateInitializer {
198 static inline RelocInfo::Mode rmode_for(T) { return RelocInfo::NO_INFO; }
199 static inline int64_t immediate_for(T t) {
200 static_assert(sizeof(T) <= 8);
201 static_assert(std::is_integral<T>::value || std::is_enum<T>::value);
202 return t;
203 }
204};
205
206template <>
207struct ImmediateInitializer<Tagged<Smi>> {
208 static inline RelocInfo::Mode rmode_for(Tagged<Smi> t) {
209 return RelocInfo::NO_INFO;
210 }
211 static inline int64_t immediate_for(Tagged<Smi> t) {
212 return static_cast<int64_t>(t.ptr());
213 }
214};
215
216template <>
217struct ImmediateInitializer<ExternalReference> {
218 static inline RelocInfo::Mode rmode_for(ExternalReference t) {
219 return RelocInfo::EXTERNAL_REFERENCE;
220 }
221 static inline int64_t immediate_for(ExternalReference t) {
222 return static_cast<int64_t>(t.address());
223 }
224};
225
226template <typename T>
227Immediate::Immediate(Handle<T> handle, RelocInfo::Mode mode)
228 : value_(static_cast<intptr_t>(handle.address())), rmode_(mode) {
229 DCHECK(RelocInfo::IsEmbeddedObjectMode(mode));
230}
231
232template <typename T>
233Immediate::Immediate(T t)
234 : value_(ImmediateInitializer<T>::immediate_for(t)),
235 rmode_(ImmediateInitializer<T>::rmode_for(t)) {}
236
237template <typename T>
238Immediate::Immediate(T t, RelocInfo::Mode rmode)
239 : value_(ImmediateInitializer<T>::immediate_for(t)), rmode_(rmode) {
240 static_assert(std::is_integral<T>::value);
241}
242
243template <typename T>
244Operand::Operand(T t) : immediate_(t), reg_(NoReg) {}
245
246template <typename T>
247Operand::Operand(T t, RelocInfo::Mode rmode)
248 : immediate_(t, rmode), reg_(NoReg) {}
249
250Operand::Operand(Register reg, Shift shift, unsigned shift_amount)
251 : immediate_(0),
252 reg_(reg),
253 shift_(shift),
254 extend_(NO_EXTEND),
255 shift_amount_(shift_amount) {
256 DCHECK(reg.Is64Bits() || (shift_amount < kWRegSizeInBits));
257 DCHECK(reg.Is32Bits() || (shift_amount < kXRegSizeInBits));
258 DCHECK_IMPLIES(reg.IsSP(), shift_amount == 0);
259}
260
261Operand::Operand(Register reg, Extend extend, unsigned shift_amount)
262 : immediate_(0),
263 reg_(reg),
264 shift_(NO_SHIFT),
265 extend_(extend),
266 shift_amount_(shift_amount) {
267 DCHECK(reg.is_valid());
268 DCHECK_LE(shift_amount, 4);
269 DCHECK(!reg.IsSP());
270
271 // Extend modes SXTX and UXTX require a 64-bit register.
272 DCHECK(reg.Is64Bits() || ((extend != SXTX) && (extend != UXTX)));
273}
274
275bool Operand::IsHeapNumberRequest() const {
276 DCHECK_IMPLIES(heap_number_request_.has_value(), reg_ == NoReg);
277 DCHECK_IMPLIES(heap_number_request_.has_value(),
278 immediate_.rmode() == RelocInfo::FULL_EMBEDDED_OBJECT ||
279 immediate_.rmode() == RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
280 return heap_number_request_.has_value();
281}
282
283HeapNumberRequest Operand::heap_number_request() const {
284 DCHECK(IsHeapNumberRequest());
285 return *heap_number_request_;
286}
287
288bool Operand::IsImmediate() const {
289 return reg_ == NoReg && !IsHeapNumberRequest();
290}
291
292bool Operand::IsShiftedRegister() const {
293 return reg_.is_valid() && (shift_ != NO_SHIFT);
294}
295
296bool Operand::IsExtendedRegister() const {
297 return reg_.is_valid() && (extend_ != NO_EXTEND);
298}
299
300bool Operand::IsZero() const {
301 if (IsImmediate()) {
302 return ImmediateValue() == 0;
303 } else {
304 return reg().IsZero();
305 }
306}
307
308Operand Operand::ToExtendedRegister() const {
309 DCHECK(IsShiftedRegister());
310 DCHECK((shift_ == LSL) && (shift_amount_ <= 4));
311 return Operand(reg_, reg_.Is64Bits() ? UXTX : UXTW, shift_amount_);
312}
313
314Operand Operand::ToW() const {
315 if (IsShiftedRegister()) {
316 DCHECK(reg_.Is64Bits());
317 return Operand(reg_.W(), shift(), shift_amount());
318 } else if (IsExtendedRegister()) {
319 DCHECK(reg_.Is64Bits());
320 return Operand(reg_.W(), extend(), shift_amount());
321 }
322 DCHECK(IsImmediate());
323 return *this;
324}
325
326Immediate Operand::immediate_for_heap_number_request() const {
327 DCHECK(immediate_.rmode() == RelocInfo::FULL_EMBEDDED_OBJECT);
328 return immediate_;
329}
330
331Immediate Operand::immediate() const {
332 DCHECK(IsImmediate());
333 return immediate_;
334}
335
336int64_t Operand::ImmediateValue() const {
337 DCHECK(IsImmediate());
338 return immediate_.value();
339}
340
341RelocInfo::Mode Operand::ImmediateRMode() const {
342 DCHECK(IsImmediate() || IsHeapNumberRequest());
343 return immediate_.rmode();
344}
345
346Register Operand::reg() const {
347 DCHECK(IsShiftedRegister() || IsExtendedRegister());
348 return reg_;
349}
350
351Shift Operand::shift() const {
352 DCHECK(IsShiftedRegister());
353 return shift_;
354}
355
356Extend Operand::extend() const {
357 DCHECK(IsExtendedRegister());
358 return extend_;
359}
360
361unsigned Operand::shift_amount() const {
362 DCHECK(IsShiftedRegister() || IsExtendedRegister());
363 return shift_amount_;
364}
365
366MemOperand::MemOperand()
367 : base_(NoReg),
368 regoffset_(NoReg),
369 offset_(0),
370 addrmode_(Offset),
371 shift_(NO_SHIFT),
372 extend_(NO_EXTEND),
373 shift_amount_(0) {}
374
375MemOperand::MemOperand(Register base, int64_t offset, AddrMode addrmode)
376 : base_(base),
377 regoffset_(NoReg),
378 offset_(offset),
379 addrmode_(addrmode),
380 shift_(NO_SHIFT),
381 extend_(NO_EXTEND),
382 shift_amount_(0) {
383 DCHECK(base.Is64Bits() && !base.IsZero());
384}
385
386MemOperand::MemOperand(Register base, Register regoffset, Extend extend,
387 unsigned shift_amount)
388 : base_(base),
389 regoffset_(regoffset),
390 offset_(0),
391 addrmode_(Offset),
392 shift_(NO_SHIFT),
393 extend_(extend),
394 shift_amount_(shift_amount) {
395 DCHECK(base.Is64Bits() && !base.IsZero());
396 DCHECK(!regoffset.IsSP());
397 DCHECK((extend == UXTW) || (extend == SXTW) || (extend == SXTX));
398
399 // SXTX extend mode requires a 64-bit offset register.
400 DCHECK(regoffset.Is64Bits() || (extend != SXTX));
401}
402
403MemOperand::MemOperand(Register base, Register regoffset, Shift shift,
404 unsigned shift_amount)
405 : base_(base),
406 regoffset_(regoffset),
407 offset_(0),
408 addrmode_(Offset),
409 shift_(shift),
410 extend_(NO_EXTEND),
411 shift_amount_(shift_amount) {
412 DCHECK(base.Is64Bits() && !base.IsZero());
413 DCHECK(regoffset.Is64Bits() && !regoffset.IsSP());
414 DCHECK(shift == LSL);
415}
416
417MemOperand::MemOperand(Register base, const Operand& offset, AddrMode addrmode)
418 : base_(base), regoffset_(NoReg), addrmode_(addrmode) {
419 DCHECK(base.Is64Bits() && !base.IsZero());
420
421 if (offset.IsImmediate()) {
422 offset_ = offset.ImmediateValue();
423 } else if (offset.IsShiftedRegister()) {
424 DCHECK((addrmode == Offset) || (addrmode == PostIndex));
425
426 regoffset_ = offset.reg();
427 shift_ = offset.shift();
428 shift_amount_ = offset.shift_amount();
429
430 extend_ = NO_EXTEND;
431 offset_ = 0;
432
433 // These assertions match those in the shifted-register constructor.
434 DCHECK(regoffset_.Is64Bits() && !regoffset_.IsSP());
435 DCHECK(shift_ == LSL);
436 } else {
437 DCHECK(offset.IsExtendedRegister());
438 DCHECK(addrmode == Offset);
439
440 regoffset_ = offset.reg();
441 extend_ = offset.extend();
442 shift_amount_ = offset.shift_amount();
443
444 shift_ = NO_SHIFT;
445 offset_ = 0;
446
447 // These assertions match those in the extended-register constructor.
448 DCHECK(!regoffset_.IsSP());
449 DCHECK((extend_ == UXTW) || (extend_ == SXTW) || (extend_ == SXTX));
450 DCHECK((regoffset_.Is64Bits() || (extend_ != SXTX)));
451 }
452}
453
454bool MemOperand::IsImmediateOffset() const {
455 return (addrmode_ == Offset) && regoffset_ == NoReg;
456}
457
458bool MemOperand::IsRegisterOffset() const {
459 return (addrmode_ == Offset) && regoffset_ != NoReg;
460}
461
462bool MemOperand::IsPreIndex() const { return addrmode_ == PreIndex; }
463
464bool MemOperand::IsPostIndex() const { return addrmode_ == PostIndex; }
465
466void Assembler::Unreachable() { debug("UNREACHABLE", __LINE__, BREAK); }
467
468Address Assembler::target_pointer_address_at(Address pc) {
469 Instruction* instr = reinterpret_cast<Instruction*>(pc);
470 DCHECK(instr->IsLdrLiteralX() || instr->IsLdrLiteralW());
471 return reinterpret_cast<Address>(instr->ImmPCOffsetTarget());
472}
473
474// Read/Modify the code target address in the branch/call instruction at pc.
475Address Assembler::target_address_at(Address pc, Address constant_pool) {
476 Instruction* instr = reinterpret_cast<Instruction*>(pc);
477 if (instr->IsLdrLiteralX()) {
478 return Memory<Address>(target_pointer_address_at(pc));
479 } else {
480 DCHECK(instr->IsBranchAndLink() || instr->IsUnconditionalBranch());
481 return reinterpret_cast<Address>(instr->ImmPCOffsetTarget());
482 }
483}
484
485Tagged_t Assembler::target_compressed_address_at(Address pc,
486 Address constant_pool) {
487 Instruction* instr = reinterpret_cast<Instruction*>(pc);
488 CHECK(instr->IsLdrLiteralW());
489 return Memory<Tagged_t>(target_pointer_address_at(pc));
490}
491
492Handle<Code> Assembler::code_target_object_handle_at(Address pc) {
493 Instruction* instr = reinterpret_cast<Instruction*>(pc);
494 if (instr->IsLdrLiteralX()) {
495 return Handle<Code>(reinterpret_cast<Address*>(
496 Assembler::target_address_at(pc, 0 /* unused */)));
497 } else {
498 DCHECK(instr->IsBranchAndLink() || instr->IsUnconditionalBranch());
499 DCHECK_EQ(instr->ImmPCOffset() % kInstrSize, 0);
500 return Handle<Code>::cast(
501 GetEmbeddedObject(instr->ImmPCOffset() >> kInstrSizeLog2));
502 }
503}
504
505AssemblerBase::EmbeddedObjectIndex
506Assembler::embedded_object_index_referenced_from(Address pc) {
507 Instruction* instr = reinterpret_cast<Instruction*>(pc);
508 if (instr->IsLdrLiteralX()) {
509 static_assert(sizeof(EmbeddedObjectIndex) == sizeof(intptr_t));
510 return Memory<EmbeddedObjectIndex>(target_pointer_address_at(pc));
511 } else {
512 DCHECK(instr->IsLdrLiteralW());
513 return Memory<uint32_t>(target_pointer_address_at(pc));
514 }
515}
516
517void Assembler::set_embedded_object_index_referenced_from(
518 Address pc, EmbeddedObjectIndex data) {
519 Instruction* instr = reinterpret_cast<Instruction*>(pc);
520 if (instr->IsLdrLiteralX()) {
521 Memory<EmbeddedObjectIndex>(target_pointer_address_at(pc)) = data;
522 } else {
523 DCHECK(instr->IsLdrLiteralW());
524 DCHECK(is_uint32(data));
525 WriteUnalignedValue<uint32_t>(target_pointer_address_at(pc),
526 static_cast<uint32_t>(data));
527 }
528}
529
530Handle<HeapObject> Assembler::target_object_handle_at(Address pc) {
531 return GetEmbeddedObject(
532 Assembler::embedded_object_index_referenced_from(pc));
533}
534
535Builtin Assembler::target_builtin_at(Address pc) {
536 Instruction* instr = reinterpret_cast<Instruction*>(pc);
537 DCHECK(instr->IsBranchAndLink() || instr->IsUnconditionalBranch());
538 DCHECK_EQ(instr->ImmPCOffset() % kInstrSize, 0);
539 int builtin_id = static_cast<int>(instr->ImmPCOffset() / kInstrSize);
540 DCHECK(Builtins::IsBuiltinId(builtin_id));
541 return static_cast<Builtin>(builtin_id);
542}
543
544int Assembler::deserialization_special_target_size(Address location) {
545 Instruction* instr = reinterpret_cast<Instruction*>(location);
546 if (instr->IsBranchAndLink() || instr->IsUnconditionalBranch()) {
547 return kSpecialTargetSize;
548 } else {
549 DCHECK_EQ(instr->InstructionBits(), 0);
550 return kSystemPointerSize;
551 }
552}
553
554void Assembler::deserialization_set_special_target_at(Address location,
555 Tagged<Code> code,
556 Address target) {
557 Instruction* instr = reinterpret_cast<Instruction*>(location);
558 if (instr->IsBranchAndLink() || instr->IsUnconditionalBranch()) {
559 if (target == 0) {
560 // We are simply wiping the target out for serialization. Set the offset
561 // to zero instead.
562 target = location;
563 }
564 instr->SetBranchImmTarget<UncondBranchType>(
565 reinterpret_cast<Instruction*>(target));
566 FlushInstructionCache(location, kInstrSize);
567 } else {
568 DCHECK_EQ(instr->InstructionBits(), 0);
569 Memory<Address>(location) = target;
570 // Intuitively, we would think it is necessary to always flush the
571 // instruction cache after patching a target address in the code. However,
572 // in this case, only the constant pool contents change. The instruction
573 // accessing the constant pool remains unchanged, so a flush is not
574 // required.
575 }
576}
577
578void Assembler::deserialization_set_target_internal_reference_at(
579 Address pc, Address target, RelocInfo::Mode mode) {
580 WriteUnalignedValue<Address>(pc, target);
581}
582
583void Assembler::set_target_address_at(Address pc, Address constant_pool,
584 Address target,
585 ICacheFlushMode icache_flush_mode) {
586 Instruction* instr = reinterpret_cast<Instruction*>(pc);
587 if (instr->IsLdrLiteralX()) {
588 Memory<Address>(target_pointer_address_at(pc)) = target;
589 // Intuitively, we would think it is necessary to always flush the
590 // instruction cache after patching a target address in the code. However,
591 // in this case, only the constant pool contents change. The instruction
592 // accessing the constant pool remains unchanged, so a flush is not
593 // required.
594 } else {
595 DCHECK(instr->IsBranchAndLink() || instr->IsUnconditionalBranch());
596 if (target == 0) {
597 // We are simply wiping the target out for serialization. Set the offset
598 // to zero instead.
599 target = pc;
600 }
601 instr->SetBranchImmTarget<UncondBranchType>(
602 reinterpret_cast<Instruction*>(target));
603 if (icache_flush_mode != SKIP_ICACHE_FLUSH) {
604 FlushInstructionCache(pc, kInstrSize);
605 }
606 }
607}
608
609void Assembler::set_target_compressed_address_at(
610 Address pc, Address constant_pool, Tagged_t target,
611 ICacheFlushMode icache_flush_mode) {
612 Instruction* instr = reinterpret_cast<Instruction*>(pc);
613 CHECK(instr->IsLdrLiteralW());
614 Memory<Tagged_t>(target_pointer_address_at(pc)) = target;
615}
616
617int RelocInfo::target_address_size() {
618 if (IsCodedSpecially()) {
619 return Assembler::kSpecialTargetSize;
620 } else {
621 Instruction* instr = reinterpret_cast<Instruction*>(pc_);
622 DCHECK(instr->IsLdrLiteralX() || instr->IsLdrLiteralW());
623 return instr->IsLdrLiteralW() ? kTaggedSize : kSystemPointerSize;
624 }
625}
626
627Address RelocInfo::target_address() {
628 DCHECK(IsCodeTarget(rmode_) || IsNearBuiltinEntry(rmode_) ||
629 IsWasmCall(rmode_) || IsWasmStubCall(rmode_));
630 return Assembler::target_address_at(pc_, constant_pool_);
631}
632
633Address RelocInfo::target_address_address() {
634 DCHECK(HasTargetAddressAddress());
635 Instruction* instr = reinterpret_cast<Instruction*>(pc_);
636 // Read the address of the word containing the target_address in an
637 // instruction stream.
638 // The only architecture-independent user of this function is the serializer.
639 // The serializer uses it to find out how many raw bytes of instruction to
640 // output before the next target.
641 // For an instruction like B/BL, where the target bits are mixed into the
642 // instruction bits, the size of the target will be zero, indicating that the
643 // serializer should not step forward in memory after a target is resolved
644 // and written.
645 // For LDR literal instructions, we can skip up to the constant pool entry
646 // address. We make sure that RelocInfo is ordered by the
647 // target_address_address so that we do not skip over any relocatable
648 // instruction sequences.
649 if (instr->IsLdrLiteralX()) {
650 return constant_pool_entry_address();
651 } else {
652 DCHECK(instr->IsBranchAndLink() || instr->IsUnconditionalBranch());
653 return pc_;
654 }
655}
656
657Address RelocInfo::constant_pool_entry_address() {
658 DCHECK(IsInConstantPool());
659 return Assembler::target_pointer_address_at(pc_);
660}
661
662Tagged<HeapObject> RelocInfo::target_object(PtrComprCageBase cage_base) {
663 DCHECK(IsCodeTarget(rmode_) || IsEmbeddedObjectMode(rmode_));
664 if (IsCompressedEmbeddedObject(rmode_)) {
665 Tagged_t compressed =
666 Assembler::target_compressed_address_at(pc_, constant_pool_);
667 DCHECK(!HAS_SMI_TAG(compressed));
668 Tagged<Object> obj(
669 V8HeapCompressionScheme::DecompressTagged(cage_base, compressed));
670 return HeapObject::cast(obj);
671 } else {
672 return HeapObject::cast(
673 Tagged<Object>(Assembler::target_address_at(pc_, constant_pool_)));
674 }
675}
676
677Handle<HeapObject> RelocInfo::target_object_handle(Assembler* origin) {
678 if (IsEmbeddedObjectMode(rmode_)) {
679 return origin->target_object_handle_at(pc_);
680 } else {
681 DCHECK(IsCodeTarget(rmode_));
682 return origin->code_target_object_handle_at(pc_);
683 }
684}
685
686void WritableRelocInfo::set_target_object(Tagged<HeapObject> target,
687 ICacheFlushMode icache_flush_mode) {
688 DCHECK(IsCodeTarget(rmode_) || IsEmbeddedObjectMode(rmode_));
689 if (IsCompressedEmbeddedObject(rmode_)) {
690 DCHECK(COMPRESS_POINTERS_BOOL);
691 // We must not compress pointers to objects outside of the main pointer
692 // compression cage as we wouldn't be able to decompress them with the
693 // correct cage base.
694 DCHECK_IMPLIES(V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX_BOOL, !IsTrustedSpaceObject(target));
695 DCHECK_IMPLIES(V8_EXTERNAL_CODE_SPACE_BOOL, !IsCodeSpaceObject(target));
696 Assembler::set_target_compressed_address_at(
697 pc_, constant_pool_,
698 V8HeapCompressionScheme::CompressObject(target.ptr()),
699 icache_flush_mode);
700 } else {
701 DCHECK(IsFullEmbeddedObject(rmode_));
702 Assembler::set_target_address_at(pc_, constant_pool_, target.ptr(),
703 icache_flush_mode);
704 }
705}
706
707Address RelocInfo::target_external_reference() {
708 DCHECK(rmode_ == EXTERNAL_REFERENCE);
709 return Assembler::target_address_at(pc_, constant_pool_);
710}
711
712void WritableRelocInfo::set_target_external_reference(
713 Address target, ICacheFlushMode icache_flush_mode) {
714 DCHECK(rmode_ == RelocInfo::EXTERNAL_REFERENCE);
715 Assembler::set_target_address_at(pc_, constant_pool_, target,
716 icache_flush_mode);
717}
718
719Address RelocInfo::target_internal_reference() {
720 DCHECK(rmode_ == INTERNAL_REFERENCE);
721 return ReadUnalignedValue<Address>(pc_);
722}
723
724Address RelocInfo::target_internal_reference_address() {
725 DCHECK(rmode_ == INTERNAL_REFERENCE);
726 return pc_;
727}
728
729Builtin RelocInfo::target_builtin_at(Assembler* origin) {
730 DCHECK(IsNearBuiltinEntry(rmode_));
731 return Assembler::target_builtin_at(pc_);
732}
733
734Address RelocInfo::target_off_heap_target() {
735 DCHECK(IsOffHeapTarget(rmode_));
736 return Assembler::target_address_at(pc_, constant_pool_);
737}
738
739LoadStoreOp Assembler::LoadOpFor(const CPURegister& rt) {
740 DCHECK(rt.is_valid());
741 if (rt.IsRegister()) {
742 return rt.Is64Bits() ? LDR_x : LDR_w;
743 } else {
744 DCHECK(rt.IsVRegister());
745 switch (rt.SizeInBits()) {
746 case kBRegSizeInBits:
747 return LDR_b;
748 case kHRegSizeInBits:
749 return LDR_h;
750 case kSRegSizeInBits:
751 return LDR_s;
752 case kDRegSizeInBits:
753 return LDR_d;
754 default:
755 DCHECK(rt.IsQ());
756 return LDR_q;
757 }
758 }
759}
760
761LoadStoreOp Assembler::StoreOpFor(const CPURegister& rt) {
762 DCHECK(rt.is_valid());
763 if (rt.IsRegister()) {
764 return rt.Is64Bits() ? STR_x : STR_w;
765 } else {
766 DCHECK(rt.IsVRegister());
767 switch (rt.SizeInBits()) {
768 case kBRegSizeInBits:
769 return STR_b;
770 case kHRegSizeInBits:
771 return STR_h;
772 case kSRegSizeInBits:
773 return STR_s;
774 case kDRegSizeInBits:
775 return STR_d;
776 default:
777 DCHECK(rt.IsQ());
778 return STR_q;
779 }
780 }
781}
782
783LoadStorePairOp Assembler::LoadPairOpFor(const CPURegister& rt,
784 const CPURegister& rt2) {
785 DCHECK_EQ(STP_w | LoadStorePairLBit, LDP_w);
786 return static_cast<LoadStorePairOp>(StorePairOpFor(rt, rt2) |
787 LoadStorePairLBit);
788}
789
790LoadStorePairOp Assembler::StorePairOpFor(const CPURegister& rt,
791 const CPURegister& rt2) {
792 DCHECK(AreSameSizeAndType(rt, rt2));
793 USE(rt2);
794 if (rt.IsRegister()) {
795 return rt.Is64Bits() ? STP_x : STP_w;
796 } else {
797 DCHECK(rt.IsVRegister());
798 switch (rt.SizeInBits()) {
799 case kSRegSizeInBits:
800 return STP_s;
801 case kDRegSizeInBits:
802 return STP_d;
803 default:
804 DCHECK(rt.IsQ());
805 return STP_q;
806 }
807 }
808}
809
810LoadLiteralOp Assembler::LoadLiteralOpFor(const CPURegister& rt) {
811 if (rt.IsRegister()) {
812 return rt.Is64Bits() ? LDR_x_lit : LDR_w_lit;
813 } else {
814 DCHECK(rt.IsVRegister());
815 return rt.Is64Bits() ? LDR_d_lit : LDR_s_lit;
816 }
817}
818
819inline void Assembler::LoadStoreScaledImmOffset(Instr memop, int offset,
820 unsigned size) {
821 Emit(LoadStoreUnsignedOffsetFixed | memop | ImmLSUnsigned(offset >> size));
822}
823
824inline void Assembler::LoadStoreUnscaledImmOffset(Instr memop, int offset) {
825 Emit(LoadStoreUnscaledOffsetFixed | memop | ImmLS(offset));
826}
827
828inline void Assembler::LoadStoreWRegOffset(Instr memop,
829 const Register& regoffset) {
830 Emit(LoadStoreRegisterOffsetFixed | memop | Rm(regoffset) | ExtendMode(UXTW));
831}
832
833inline void Assembler::DataProcPlainRegister(const Register& rd,
834 const Register& rn,
835 const Register& rm, Instr op) {
836 DCHECK(AreSameSizeAndType(rd, rn, rm));
837 Emit(SF(rd) | AddSubShiftedFixed | op | Rm(rm) | Rn(rn) | Rd(rd));
838}
839
840inline void Assembler::CmpPlainRegister(const Register& rn,
841 const Register& rm) {
842 DCHECK(AreSameSizeAndType(rn, rm));
843 Emit(SF(rn) | AddSubShiftedFixed | SUB | Flags(SetFlags) | Rm(rm) | Rn(rn) |
844 Rd(xzr));
845}
846
847inline void Assembler::DataProcImmediate(const Register& rd, const Register& rn,
848 int immediate, Instr op) {
849 DCHECK(AreSameSizeAndType(rd, rn));
850 DCHECK(IsImmAddSub(immediate));
851 Emit(SF(rd) | AddSubImmediateFixed | op | ImmAddSub(immediate) | RdSP(rd) |
852 RnSP(rn));
853}
854
855int Assembler::LinkAndGetBranchInstructionOffsetTo(Label* label) {
856 DCHECK_EQ(kStartOfLabelLinkChain, 0);
857 int offset = LinkAndGetByteOffsetTo(label);
858 DCHECK(IsAligned(offset, kInstrSize));
859 if (label->is_linked() && (offset != kStartOfLabelLinkChain)) {
860 branch_link_chain_back_edge_.emplace(
861 std::pair<int, int>(pc_offset() + offset, pc_offset()));
862 }
863 return offset >> kInstrSizeLog2;
864}
865
866Instr Assembler::Flags(FlagsUpdate S) {
867 if (S == SetFlags) {
868 return 1 << FlagsUpdate_offset;
869 } else if (S == LeaveFlags) {
870 return 0 << FlagsUpdate_offset;
871 }
872 UNREACHABLE();
873}
874
875Instr Assembler::Cond(Condition cond) { return cond << Condition_offset; }
876
877Instr Assembler::ImmPCRelAddress(int imm21) {
878 Instr imm = static_cast<Instr>(checked_truncate_to_int21(imm21));
879 Instr immhi = (imm >> ImmPCRelLo_width) << ImmPCRelHi_offset;
880 Instr immlo = imm << ImmPCRelLo_offset;
881 return (immhi & ImmPCRelHi_mask) | (immlo & ImmPCRelLo_mask);
882}
883
884Instr Assembler::ImmUncondBranch(int imm26) {
885 return checked_truncate_to_int26(imm26) << ImmUncondBranch_offset;
886}
887
888Instr Assembler::ImmCondBranch(int imm19) {
889 return checked_truncate_to_int19(imm19) << ImmCondBranch_offset;
890}
891
892Instr Assembler::ImmCmpBranch(int imm19) {
893 return checked_truncate_to_int19(imm19) << ImmCmpBranch_offset;
894}
895
896Instr Assembler::ImmTestBranch(int imm14) {
897 return checked_truncate_to_int14(imm14) << ImmTestBranch_offset;
898}
899
900Instr Assembler::ImmTestBranchBit(unsigned bit_pos) {
901 DCHECK(is_uint6(bit_pos));
902 // Subtract five from the shift offset, as we need bit 5 from bit_pos.
903 unsigned b5 = bit_pos << (ImmTestBranchBit5_offset - 5);
904 unsigned b40 = bit_pos << ImmTestBranchBit40_offset;
905 b5 &= ImmTestBranchBit5_mask;
906 b40 &= ImmTestBranchBit40_mask;
907 return b5 | b40;
908}
909
910Instr Assembler::SF(Register rd) {
911 return rd.Is64Bits() ? SixtyFourBits : ThirtyTwoBits;
912}
913
914Instr Assembler::ImmAddSub(int imm) {
915 DCHECK(IsImmAddSub(imm));
916 if (is_uint12(imm)) { // No shift required.
917 imm <<= ImmAddSub_offset;
918 } else {
919 imm = ((imm >> 12) << ImmAddSub_offset) | (1 << ShiftAddSub_offset);
920 }
921 return imm;
922}
923
924Instr Assembler::ImmS(unsigned imms, unsigned reg_size) {
925 DCHECK(((reg_size == kXRegSizeInBits) && is_uint6(imms)) ||
926 ((reg_size == kWRegSizeInBits) && is_uint5(imms)));
927 USE(reg_size);
928 return imms << ImmS_offset;
929}
930
931Instr Assembler::ImmR(unsigned immr, unsigned reg_size) {
932 DCHECK(((reg_size == kXRegSizeInBits) && is_uint6(immr)) ||
933 ((reg_size == kWRegSizeInBits) && is_uint5(immr)));
934 USE(reg_size);
935 DCHECK(is_uint6(immr));
936 return immr << ImmR_offset;
937}
938
939Instr Assembler::ImmSetBits(unsigned imms, unsigned reg_size) {
940 DCHECK((reg_size == kWRegSizeInBits) || (reg_size == kXRegSizeInBits));
941 DCHECK(is_uint6(imms));
942 DCHECK((reg_size == kXRegSizeInBits) || is_uint6(imms + 3));
943 USE(reg_size);
944 return imms << ImmSetBits_offset;
945}
946
947Instr Assembler::ImmRotate(unsigned immr, unsigned reg_size) {
948 DCHECK((reg_size == kWRegSizeInBits) || (reg_size == kXRegSizeInBits));
949 DCHECK(((reg_size == kXRegSizeInBits) && is_uint6(immr)) ||
950 ((reg_size == kWRegSizeInBits) && is_uint5(immr)));
951 USE(reg_size);
952 return immr << ImmRotate_offset;
953}
954
955Instr Assembler::ImmLLiteral(int imm19) {
956 return checked_truncate_to_int19(imm19) << ImmLLiteral_offset;
957}
958
959Instr Assembler::BitN(unsigned bitn, unsigned reg_size) {
960 DCHECK((reg_size == kWRegSizeInBits) || (reg_size == kXRegSizeInBits));
961 DCHECK((reg_size == kXRegSizeInBits) || (bitn == 0));
962 USE(reg_size);
963 return bitn << BitN_offset;
964}
965
966Instr Assembler::ShiftDP(Shift shift) {
967 DCHECK(shift == LSL || shift == LSR || shift == ASR || shift == ROR);
968 return shift << ShiftDP_offset;
969}
970
971Instr Assembler::ImmDPShift(unsigned amount) {
972 DCHECK(is_uint6(amount));
973 return amount << ImmDPShift_offset;
974}
975
976Instr Assembler::ExtendMode(Extend extend) {
977 return extend << ExtendMode_offset;
978}
979
980Instr Assembler::ImmExtendShift(unsigned left_shift) {
981 DCHECK_LE(left_shift, 4);
982 return left_shift << ImmExtendShift_offset;
983}
984
985Instr Assembler::ImmCondCmp(unsigned imm) {
986 DCHECK(is_uint5(imm));
987 return imm << ImmCondCmp_offset;
988}
989
990Instr Assembler::Nzcv(StatusFlags nzcv) {
991 return ((nzcv >> Flags_offset) & 0xf) << Nzcv_offset;
992}
993
994Instr Assembler::ImmLSUnsigned(int imm12) {
995 DCHECK(is_uint12(imm12));
996 return imm12 << ImmLSUnsigned_offset;
997}
998
999Instr Assembler::ImmLS(int imm9) {
1000 return checked_truncate_to_int9(imm9) << ImmLS_offset;
1001}
1002
1003Instr Assembler::ImmLSPair(int imm7, unsigned size) {
1004 DCHECK_EQ(imm7,
1005 static_cast<int>(static_cast<uint32_t>(imm7 >> size) << size));
1006 int scaled_imm7 = imm7 >> size;
1007 return checked_truncate_to_int7(scaled_imm7) << ImmLSPair_offset;
1008}
1009
1010Instr Assembler::ImmShiftLS(unsigned shift_amount) {
1011 DCHECK(is_uint1(shift_amount));
1012 return shift_amount << ImmShiftLS_offset;
1013}
1014
1015Instr Assembler::ImmException(int imm16) {
1016 DCHECK(is_uint16(imm16));
1017 return imm16 << ImmException_offset;
1018}
1019
1020Instr Assembler::ImmSystemRegister(int imm15) {
1021 DCHECK(is_uint15(imm15));
1022 return imm15 << ImmSystemRegister_offset;
1023}
1024
1025Instr Assembler::ImmHint(int imm7) {
1026 DCHECK(is_uint7(imm7));
1027 return imm7 << ImmHint_offset;
1028}
1029
1030Instr Assembler::ImmBarrierDomain(int imm2) {
1031 DCHECK(is_uint2(imm2));
1032 return imm2 << ImmBarrierDomain_offset;
1033}
1034
1035Instr Assembler::ImmBarrierType(int imm2) {
1036 DCHECK(is_uint2(imm2));
1037 return imm2 << ImmBarrierType_offset;
1038}
1039
1040unsigned Assembler::CalcLSDataSizeLog2(LoadStoreOp op) {
1041 DCHECK((LSSize_offset + LSSize_width) == (kInstrSize * 8));
1042 unsigned size_log2 = static_cast<Instr>(op >> LSSize_offset);
1043 if ((op & LSVector_mask) != 0) {
1044 // Vector register memory operations encode the access size in the "size"
1045 // and "opc" fields.
1046 if (size_log2 == 0 && ((op & LSOpc_mask) >> LSOpc_offset) >= 2) {
1047 size_log2 = kQRegSizeLog2;
1048 }
1049 }
1050 return size_log2;
1051}
1052
1053Instr Assembler::ImmMoveWide(int imm) {
1054 DCHECK(is_uint16(imm));
1055 return imm << ImmMoveWide_offset;
1056}
1057
1058Instr Assembler::ShiftMoveWide(int shift) {
1059 DCHECK(is_uint2(shift));
1060 return shift << ShiftMoveWide_offset;
1061}
1062
1063Instr Assembler::FPType(VRegister fd) { return fd.Is64Bits() ? FP64 : FP32; }
1064
1065Instr Assembler::FPScale(unsigned scale) {
1066 DCHECK(is_uint6(scale));
1067 return scale << FPScale_offset;
1068}
1069
1070const Register& Assembler::AppropriateZeroRegFor(const CPURegister& reg) const {
1071 return reg.Is64Bits() ? xzr : wzr;
1072}
1073
1074EnsureSpace::EnsureSpace(Assembler* assembler) : block_pools_scope_(assembler) {
1075 assembler->CheckBufferSpace();
1076}
